definition: paper/CL:張|张[zhang1],沓[da2]/classifier for documents, letter etc

sentences.english: Passersby, one by one, threw paper money and coins into the small bucket beside his feet.
sentences.chinese: 过路人纷纷向他脚下的一个小铁桶里扔着纸币和硬币。

sentences.english: It has simply lost its physical body, gone virtual.
sentences.chinese: 它仅仅只是失去了纸币的皮囊，变成虚拟货币而已。

sentences.english: Instead of gold, all that was needed to produce more banknotes was paper, ink, and a printing press.
sentences.chinese: 和黄金不同，生产纸币只需要纸墨和一台印刷机。

sentences.english: Airline personnel collect the spare coins and paper currency from passengers.
sentences.chinese: 航空公司工作人员从乘客那里收集这些硬币和纸币。

sentences.english: For millennia, humans have exchanged metal coins and bits of paper to pay each other.
sentences.chinese: 数千年来，人们用金属货币和少量的纸币相互交易。

sentences.english: He gave his mother a ten-pound note.
sentences.chinese: 他给他母亲一张十英镑的纸币。

sentences.english: Could you give me a couple of fives for this ten-dollar bill?
sentences.chinese: 你可以把这十元纸币转做两张五元纸币吗？

sentences.english: Could you give me a couple of fives for this ten-dollar bill?
sentences.chinese: 你可以把这十元纸币转做两张五元纸币吗？

sentences.english: When anyone leaves paper money in a fire，the fire burn sit.
sentences.chinese: 如果有人把纸币留在火里，火就会把它烧成灰烬。

sentences.english: I'd some coins for this hundred yuan note.
sentences.chinese: 我想把这一百元纸币换成硬币。

sentences.english: They did not use paper money or gold or silver coins , as Europeans did.
sentences.chinese: 他们没有向欧洲人似的用纸币或是金，银做成的硬币。

sentences.english: It was especially popular for trading during the Ming dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 纸币在明朝的商贸交易中尤受欢迎。
八张一百美元票面的纸币。

sentences.english: So who do you think is on the 100-dollar bill?
sentences.chinese: 那么100美元纸币上的会是谁呢？

definition: fractional currency (coin or note of value smaller than the country's unit of currency)/token (used instead of money for slot machines etc)
flat silver (former coinage)/also written 銀圓|银圆/silver dollar
paper money/a bill (e.g. 100 yuan)/CL:張|张[zhang1],紮|扎[za1]
Fabi, first currency issued by the 國民黨|国民党[Guo2 min2 dang3] in 1935, in use until 1948
